Title: TEN-T Corridor Coordinators
Short Description: Nine European Coordinators have been designated today to help complete the trans-European transport network (TEN-T), a vast infrastructure network of railways, roads, and inland waterways connecting the European Union.

Title: Sustainable Transport Forum - new sub-groups on hydrogen infrastructure, zero-emission heavy-duty vehicles and public key infrastructure for e-mobility
Short Description: In the wake of the adoption of the new Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation (AFIR), the European Commission has set up three new sub-groups under the Sustainable Transport Forum (STF) expert group.

Title: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – July 2024
Short Description: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

Title: Commission enforces temporary restrictions on liquid screening at certain EU airports
Short Description: The Commission will temporarily enforce restrictions on liquid screening at EU airports utilising Explosive Detection Systems for Cabin Baggage (EDSCB).

Title: European Commission launches Ship Financing Portal to boost the maritime sector's green transition
Short Description: The Ship Financing Portal, designed to improve access to financing for the shipping sector and the wider maritime industry, is now online!

Title: July infringement package: key decisions
Short Description: July infringement package: key decisions

Title: FuelEU Maritime Regulation: Q&A on implementation
Short Description: As the maritime sector prepares for the FuelEU Maritime Regulation, a new Commission document answers key questions on its implementation.

Title: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – June 2024
Short Description: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

Title: Commission publishes new guidelines for more clarity on air passenger rights
Short Description: While more citizens of the European Union are aware of their EU passenger rights than was the case five years ago, the majority do not consider that they have enough information, according to the results of a Eurobarometer survey released today.

Title: EU invests record €7 billion in sustainable, safe and smart transport infrastructure
Short Description: The Commission has selected 134 projects to receive over €7 billion in EU grants from the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF), the EU's programme for investment in transport infrastructure.

Title: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – May 2024
Short Description: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

Title: EU and ICAO strengthen commitment to global aviation safety, security, and sustainability
Short Description: The EU and the ICAO have reaffirmed their commitment to enhancing global aviation safety, security, and sustainability during a meeting at ICAO Headquarters in Montreal on 26 June.

Title: New EU Transport Report: Current trends and issues
Short Description: The European Commission has released an overview of the latest developments in the EU transport sector, highlighting trends and issues for both the EU and individual Member States.

Title: Urban public transport – New set of recommendations adopted by the Expert Group on Urban Mobility (EGUM)
Short Description: The Commission’s Expert Group on Urban Mobility (EGUM) has adopted recommendations on complementing public transport with shared mobility, and on using the Social Climate Fund to support public transport.

Title: EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: EU-funded scanners increase capacity at Hungarian-Ukrainian border
Short Description: A new EU-funded mobile cargo scanner was delivered today to the border crossing point in Chop at the Hungarian-Ukrainian border, in a bid to improve the flow of trade across Ukraine’s borders. Valued at approximately €2.5 million, the donation is part of the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes.

Title: Europeans are generally positive towards e-mobility
Short Description: A large survey by the European Alternative Fuels Observatory (EAFO) in twelve EU Member States shows a positive attitude towards switching to battery-electric cars.

Title: EU and Ukraine update and extend Road Transport Agreement
Short Description: The EU and Ukraine decided today to prolong and update their current road transport Agreement. Implemented due to lost transport routes and export markets east of Ukraine caused by the Russian aggression, the agreement supports the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes.

Title: A sustainable and resilient transport network bringing Europe closer together
Short Description: The Commission welcomes the final adoption of the Regulation underpinning the trans-European transport network (TEN-T) by the European Parliament and the Council.

Title: European Union signs aviation agreement with the People's Republic of Bangladesh
Short Description: The European Union and Bangladesh have signed a Horizontal Aviation Agreement

Title: May infringements package: key decisions
Short Description: May infringements package: key decisions

Title: Two years of Solidarity Lanes have brought the EU, Ukraine and Moldova closer together
Short Description: Two years ago, in May 2022, the Commission, in collaboration with Ukraine and Moldova, created the Solidarity Lanes to help improve the EU–Ukraine–Moldova transport routes in response to Russia’s illegal full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

Title: Solidarity Lanes: improving the Danube routes together
Short Description: Representatives of Moldova, Romania, Ukraine, the United States  and the European Commission gathered today in Chisinau, continuing their work together to improve trade routes through the Solidarity Lanes along the Danube corridor.

Title: EU supports improved Ukrainian–Moldovan border crossing cooperation as part of Solidarity Lanes
Short Description: Today the European Commission, together with Ukraine, Moldova, Romania and the US are inaugurating the renewed Ukrainian-Moldovan border crossing point in Reni, Ukraine, as part of the Solidarity Lanes initiative.

Title: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – April 2024
Short Description: Latest figures on Ukrainian exports and imports via the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new transport routes established in the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine.

Title: Commission adopts reasoned opinion in case brought by Italy against Austria on road transport
Short Description: The Commission today adopted a reasoned opinion in a procedure brought by Italy against Austria under Article 259 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union.

Title: Excellence in Road Safety Awards 2024: applications now open
Short Description: Today, the European Road Safety Charter, the largest civil platform dedicated to road safety and led by the European Commission, opened applications for the 2024 Excellence in Road Safety Awards.

Title: April infringement package: key decisions
Short Description: April infringement package: key decisions

Title: Urban Vehicle Access Regulations (UVARs) – recommendations by the Expert Group on Urban Mobility
Short Description: The Expert Group on Urban Mobility (EGUM) has adopted its recommendations on Urban Vehicle Access Regulations .

Title: Commission and EU rail sector launch Women in Rail Award 2024
Short Description: The award, divided into three categories, aims to promote fairness, diversity, and equality, and to celebrate outstanding and inspiring women and their achievements in the rail sector.

Title: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – March 2024
Short Description: In the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine, the EU, together with Ukraine and Moldova launched the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes in May 2022, establishing new transport routes to keep Ukraine’s imports and exports flowing via rail, road and inland waterways.

Title: Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation: Q&A on operating recharging infrastructure
Short Description: The Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation (AFIR), comes into force on 13 April 2024, supporting the transition towards more sustainable transport by setting obligatory targets for the rollout of recharging and refuelling transport infrastructure.

Title: EU boosts zero-emission mobility with over €424 million in funding for 42 projects
Short Description: The Commission is announcing the selection of 42 new projects deploying alternative fuels infrastructure that will receive over €424 million in EU support.

Title: Commission paves way for safe integration of ‘air taxis' and other innovative drone uses
Short Description: The Commission adopted a set of measures to address the unique safety challenges of new emerging air mobility concepts and services and ensure that their operations will be as safe as those in manned aviation.

Title: New interactive page showcases positive impact of CEF Transport
Short Description: As part of the activities linked to the tenth anniversary of the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF) Programme, CINEA launched a new interactive web-page to showcase the contribution of the CEF for Transport Programme to greening and decarbonising the transport sector.

Title: EU institutions commit to boost cycling across Europe
Short Description: The EU is taking another important step in reducing transport emissions by adopting the European Declaration on Cycling

Title: Participatory conference on labour market developments and labour shortages in the transport sector in the European Union
Short Description: The Commission organises a participatory conference to enable discussions with and between relevant stakeholders on labour market developments

Title: Call for applications for the selection of members of the European ITS Advisory Group
Short Description: The Commission’s Directorate-General for Mobility and Transport has launched a call for applications to select new members of the European ITS Advisory Group

Title: Commissioner Vălean kicks off the Connecting Europe Days
Short Description: The Commissioner for Transport, Adina Vălean, is participating in the four-day Connecting Europe Days taking place in Brussels from 2 to 5 April 2024

Title: EU and Moldova extend Road Transport Agreement until 31 December 2025
Short Description: The EU and Moldova decided today to extend the validity of their current road transport Agreement until 31 December 2025. The Agreement aims at helping Moldova access world markets by facilitating transit through EU countries and also further developing its links with the EU market.

Title: EU and Ukraine continue strengthening Solidarity Lanes and cooperation on connectivity, safety and sustainability of transport
Short Description: The third high-level meeting of the EU-Ukraine Transport Dialogue took place yesterday in Kyiv, focusing on efforts to keep Ukraine's exports and imports moving via the Solidarity Lanes, improving connectivity, safety and security as well as sustainability.

Title: Honours for Diversity and Inclusion in Maritime, 8 March 2024
Short Description: The Belgian EU Presidency hosted the 'Conference on the Wellbeing of Seafarers' on International Women’s Day, March 8, 2024, featuring the 'Honours for Diversity and Inclusion in Maritime' award ceremony.

Title: Solidarity Lanes: Latest figures – February 2024
Short Description: In the face of Russia’s war of aggression against Ukraine, the EU, together with Ukraine and Moldova launched the EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes in May 2022, establishing new transport routes to keep Ukraine’s imports and exports flowing via rail, road and inland waterways.

Title: Budapest and online platform Nudgd recognised for green mobility activities in the European urban mobility awards
Short Description: Budapest was awarded the European Mobility Week Award in a ceremony in Brussels last night, while online platform Nudgd won the Mobility Action award.

Title: Provisional agreement on better cross-border enforcement of road safety traffic rules
Short Description: The Commission welcomes the political agreement reached last night between the European Parliament and the Council on facilitating the enforcement of road traffic rules across borders.

Title: March infringements package: key decisions
Short Description: March infringements package: key decisions

Title: 2023 figures show stalling progress in reducing road fatalities in too many countries
Short Description: Road safety in the EU 2023: Around 20 400 people were killed in road crashes last year, a small 2% decrease on 2022.

Title: Save the date for the next edition of the EU Women in Rail Awards!
Short Description: This April, the European Commission, together with Europe’s Rail, the European Union Agency for Railways, CER, UNIFE and ALE will launch the next edition of the EU Women in Rail Awards.

Title: Commission proposes to prolong road transport agreements with Ukraine and Moldova and introduces updates to the agreement with Ukraine
Short Description: The proposals, sent to the Council today, include updates to the agreement with Ukraine to improve its practical implementation and enforcement while maintaining its objectives and scope.

Title: Commission makes €1bn available for recharging and refuelling points under the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF)
Short Description: The Commission is launching a call for proposals under the Connecting Europe Facility – Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Facility (AFIF)

Title: Public workshop: adoption of new ITS Working Programme 2024-2028
Short Description: On 19 March 2024 the European Commission will organise a stakeholder workshop via videoconference to discuss the new Working Programme of the ITS Directive for the period 2024-2028.

Title: Recording available: Academic conference on future of EU mobility and transport
Short Description: On 21 February 2024, the European Commission organised an all-day academic conference on the state of play on EU transport policy and the challenges and priorities for the future of EU transport and mobility. In case you missed it, you can still watch the recording!

Title: Commission welcomes provisional agreement modernising ship inspections and oversight
Short Description: The Commission welcomes the political agreement reached between the European Parliament and the Council on updating the requirements for the Port State Control of vessels calling at EU ports, and on the flag State requirements for merchant vessels registered in EU Member States.

Title: Extraordinary G7 Transport Ministerial welcomes EU maritime operation to safeguard Red Sea maritime security
Short Description: G7 Transport Ministers expressed strong condemnation of the attacks carried out by the Houthis against commercial vessels and navy ships in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden.

Title: Commission welcomes provisional agreement on tackling ship-source pollution to help make European seas cleaner
Short Description: The Commission welcomes the political agreement between the European Parliament and the Council on the amendment of Directive 2005/35/EC on ship-source pollution and on the introduction of penalties for pollution offences.

Title: Commission welcomes provisional agreement modernising maritime accident investigations
Short Description: The Commission welcomes the political agreement reached today between the European Parliament and the Council on the investigation of maritime accidents, modernising a 2009 Directive.

Title: Focus on urban public transport – first set of recommendations adopted by the Expert Group on Urban Mobility (EGUM)
Short Description: During its last plenary meeting on 16 January the Commission Expert Group on Urban Mobility (EGUM) adopted its first set of recommendations to the European Commission, primarily influenced by the recent work of the EGUM members on public transport and shared mobility.

Title: EU and Moldova launch high-level dialogue on transport
Short Description: In a bid to strengthen cooperation in the transport field, Commissioner Adina Vălean and Moldova’s Minister for Infrastructure and Regional Development Andrei Spînu today launched the EU-Moldova high-level dialogue on transport.

Title: Global Gateway: €10 billion commitment to invest in Trans Caspian Transport Corridor connecting Europe and Central Asia announced at Investors Forum
Short Description: Executive Vice President Valdis Dombrovskis announced that European and international financial institutions present at the Forum will commit €10 billion in support and investments towards sustainable transport connectivity in Central Asia.

Title: Commission proposes to modernise river information services in EU
Short Description: The Commission adopted a proposal to improve traffic management on the EU’s rivers and canals.

Title: New report comparing air traffic management performance in Europe and the United States published
Short Description: In the ongoing series of comparative reports between Europe and the US, the most recent update looks at operational as well as economic air traffic management (ATM) performance.

Title: STF: Call for applications for new sub-groups on hydrogen infrastructure, zero-emission heavy-duty vehicles and e-mobility Public Key Infrastructure
Short Description: Sustainable Transport Forum – new calls for applications

Title: Commission supports military mobility projects with €807 million
Short Description: The Commission will fund 38 additional military mobility projects to support the transport of troops and equipment along the trans-European transport network (TEN-T).

Title: New deadline for the call for applications for the selection of members of the Digital Transport and Logistics Forum (DTLF)
Short Description: Deadline for the call for applications for the selection of members of the Digital Transport and Logistics Forum (DTLF) extended.

Title: Save the date: Global TBO Symposium (4-6 June 2024)
Short Description: Towards global trajectory-based operations (TBO)

Title: European Commission workshop addresses key challenges in seafaring profession
Short Description: Decarbonisation, digitalisation, social security and wellbeing at sea were the key topics on the agenda of the workshop for the seafaring profession on 17 January.

Title: “Europe for Aviation” teams up for Airspace World 2024
Short Description: The “Europe for Aviation” partners, consisting of nine European aviation organisations working to promote the modernisation, sustainability, and resilience of a safe European aviation, will come together at Airspace World, from 19-21 March 2024 in Geneva, Switzerland.

Title: December Infringements package: key decisions
Short Description: December Infringements package: key decisions

Short Description: TEN-T Trilogue

Title: Joint Statement on Higher Airspace Operations (HAO)
Short Description: Joint Statement on Higher Airspace Operations (HAO) by the EU, the US, Canada, Japan, and the UK.

Title: Moldova receives additional funding to improve rail infrastructure and advance Solidarity Lanes
Short Description: The European Investment Bank has today signed a €41.2 million loan with Moldova, destined to improve internal transport connections as well as to provide long-term economic benefits to the wider region. This loan will be complemented by an EU grant of €12 million.

Title: Single European Sky: Performance Review Body publishes new reports prior to fourth reference period of performance and charging scheme (RP4)
Short Description: The Performance Review Body (PRB) of the Single European Sky has today published three reports on air navigation service costs.

Title: New website of the EU Urban Mobility Observatory
Short Description: New website of the EU Urban Mobility Observatory

Title: Call for applications for the selection of members of the Digital Transport and Logistics Forum (DTLF)
Short Description: The Commission is calling for applications with a view to selecting members for the DTLF other than Member States' authorities and other public entities.

Title: No title
Short Description: Transport ministers from the Western Balkans, Georgia, Moldova, and Ukraine, as well as the European Commission, gathered at the annual Ministerial Council Meeting of the Transport Community in Skopje, North Macedonia, on 12 December 2023.

Title: Statement by Commissioner for Transport Adina Vălean on the Poland–Ukraine border
Short Description: Commissioner for Transport Adina Vălean welcomed the re-opening of Dorohusk–Yahodyn border crossing point for freight transport, the most significant border crossing point between Poland and Ukraine.

Title: Open letter from European Transport Commissioner Adina Vălean on standardised weights and dimensions for hand luggage
Short Description: Open letter from European Transport Commissioner Adina Vălean on standardised weights and dimensions for hand luggage

Title: Call for experts for the Commission Expert Group on the Human Dimension of the Single European Sky (CEGHD)
Short Description: The Commission is calling for applications with a view to selecting members of the Expert Group on the Human Dimension of the Single European Sky.

Title: EU and Canada strengthen ties on maritime safety
Short Description: The Commission and the Canadian Department of Transport signed a Memorandum of Cooperation that will improveinternational cooperation on maritime safety.

Title: Commission updates EU Air Safety List and bans Fly Baghdad from flying in the European Union
Short Description: Aviation Safety: Commission adopts new EU Air Safety List – an air carrier certified in Iraq added

Title: Passenger Mobility Package
Short Description: The Commission adopted a series of proposals designed to improve the experience of passengers and travellers by strengthening their rights.

Title: Commission welcomes new UN Aviation Agency global target for sustainable aviation fuels
Short Description: The Commission welcomes the agreement on a global framework for sustainable aviation fuels and other cleaner aviation energy.

Title: November infringement package: key decisions
Short Description: November infringement package: key decisions

Title: European Commission adopts new proposal on combining transport modes for more sustainable freight
Short Description: The proposal on combined transport aims to make freight transport more sustainable by improving the competitiveness of intermodal freight – the transportation of goods using two or more transport modes – vis-à-vis road-only transport.

Title: EU signs grant agreements for transport infrastructure to better connect Moldova with EU
Short Description: The Commission welcomes the signature of three grant agreements under the CEF for Transport worth almost €45 million to improve transport connections between Moldova and Romania along the TEN-T network.

Title: No title
Short Description: European aviation leaders have come together in Valencia for the 12th edition of the ECAC/EU Dialogue, reaffirming their commitment to sustainable aviation.

Title: Smarter journey planners, better access for emergency services, and more sustainable transport thanks to revised Intelligent Transport Directive adopted today
Short Description: The Commission welcomes the final approval of the revised Intelligent Transport Systems (ITS) Directive.

Title: Q&A – Assistance to passengers for flight disruptions caused by the conflict in Israel
Short Description: Q&A

Title: Excellence in Road Safety Awards: European Commission rewards best road safety projects
Short Description: The Commission is hosting the 2023 Excellence in Road Safety Awards. The awards recognise the best contributions by the European Road Safety Charter's community of organisations, authorities and companies towards safer roads across Europe.

Title: Road safety: 20,640 people died in a road crash last year – progress remains too slow
Short Description: The 20,640 deaths on EU roads last year represented a 4% increase in relation to 2021, as traffic levels recovered after the pandemic.

Title: RLCF Alliance marks milestone in the pursuit of sustainable aviation and maritime fuels
Short Description: The second General Assembly of the RLCF Value Chain Industrial Alliance (RLCF) took place, heralding a significant step towards the production of sustainable and renewable aviation and waterborne fuels.

Title: October infringement package: key decisions
Short Description: October infringement package: key decisions

Title: Commission refers Spain to the Court of Justice of the European Union for failing to correctly transpose and apply EU rules establishing a single European railway area
Short Description: The Commission decided to refer Spain to the Court of Justice of the European Union for failing to correctly transpose and apply Directive 2012/34/EU establishing a single European railway area.

Title: Single European Sky: annual monitoring shows impact of continued lack of air traffic management capacity with negative consequences for environment and climate
Short Description: The Performance Review Body (PRB) has published the 2022 Annual Monitoring Report and Traffic Light System as part of its annual monitoring of the performance of the Member States of the Single European Sky (SES).

Title: Final adoption of ReFuelEU Aviation completes ‘Fit for 55' legislation, putting EU on track to exceed 2030 targets
Short Description: The Commission welcomes today's adoption of two final pillars of its ‘Fit for 55' legislative package for delivering the EU's 2030 climate targets.

Title: Commission proposes list of principles to boost cycling across Europe
Short Description: The proposal for a European Declaration on Cycling recognises cycling as a sustainable, accessible and inclusive, affordable and healthy means of transport, with strong added value for the EU economy.

Title: Commissioner Vălean: Opening speech at Urban Mobility Days 2023
Short Description: Commissioner Vălean: Opening speech at Urban Mobility Days 2023

Title: Single European Sky: European Commission advised to prioritise environmental performance when setting performance targets for air navigation services
Short Description: The Performance Review Body (PRB) for the Single European Sky (SES) has published its advice on EU-wide target ranges for the fourth reference period (2025 - 2029) of the SES performance and charging scheme.

Title: September infringement package: key decisions
Short Description: September infringement package: key decisions

Title: European Commission adopts 8th report on development of the rail market
Short Description: The eighth Rail Market Monitoring Report (RMMS) on the state of the EU rail market shows positive developments in 2019, before a significant change in traffic volumes in 2020 due to COVID-19.

Title: Sustainable transport: €7 billion available for key infrastructure projects under the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF)
Short Description: The Commission launches a call for proposals under the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF) for Transport.

Title: Single European Sky: new framework for interoperability rules
Short Description: The Commission has adopted a new set of rules to better manage interoperability between the systems and constituents used to provide air traffic management (ATM) and air navigation services (ANS).

Title: European Mobility Week: 3,000 cities to showcase their approaches to sustainable urban mobility
Short Description: Sustainable and energy-efficient mobility are the focus of this year’s European Mobility Week, which kicks off in 3000 towns and cities in 50 countries.

Title: Evaluation confirms European Union Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) fit for purpose
Short Description: A Commission evaluation of Regulation (EU) 2018/1139 on common rules in the field of civil aviation and establishing a European Union Aviation Safety Agency (‘EASA’) has given a positive appraisal of EASA’s performance and added value.

Title: Alternative fuels infrastructure: €352 million in EU funding for low-and zero-emission transport projects
Short Description: The Commission announced 26 projects from 12 Member States that will receive funding to install alternative fuels infrastructure along the trans-European transport network (TEN-T).

Title: Rail Transport: New harmonised EU standards to support cross-border rail
Short Description: The Commission published a package of revised technical standards to improve rail interoperability across borders – the so-called ‘Technical Specifications for Interoperability’ (TSIs).

Title: Solidarity Lanes: European Commission team of experts visits Romania to discuss capacity of Danube corridor
Short Description: The programme includes visits to the port facilities and meetings with authorities, operators, transporters and traders. The discussions will focus on means to tackle bottlenecks, increase handling capacity, improve transit and streamline procedures and controls.

Title: Call for applications for the selection of members of a sub-group to the Expert Group on Road Infrastructure Safety
Short Description: Call for applications for the selection of members of the sub-group to the Expert Group on Road Infrastructure Safety entitled "Forgiving roadsides and self explaining and self enforcing roads".

Title: European Green Deal: Energy Efficiency Directive, FuelEU Maritime Regulation and Alternative Fuel Infrastructure Regulation adopted, helping make the EU ‘Fit for 55'
Short Description: The Commission welcomes the final approval today of the revised Energy Efficiency Directive, FuelEU Maritime Regulation, Alternative Fuel Infrastructure Regulation (AFIR), as part of the ‘Fit for 55' package of legislation to reduce EU greenhouse gas emissions by at least 55% by 2030.

Title: July Infringements package: key decisions
Short Description: July Infringements package: key decisions

Title: Vacancy for an HR Officer (establishment of a reserve list) (Contract Agent– FGIV) at the Europe's Rail Joint Undertaking (EU-RAIL)
Short Description: The deadline for applications is 21/08/2023

Title: Green Deal: Greening freight for more economic gain with less environmental impact
Short Description: The Commission is today proposing measures to make freight transport more efficient and more sustainable, by improving rail infrastructure management, offering stronger incentives for low-emission lorries, and better information on freight transport greenhouse gas emissions.

Title: Study sets out step-by-step plan for better EU rail connections with Ukraine and Moldova
Short Description: A study assessing the options for increasing rail connectivity and interoperability between the EU, Ukraine and Moldova has concluded that the first step to improving connections between Poland and Ukraine...

Title: Maritime transport emissions: Commission welcomes new IMO climate ambition for 2030, 2040 and 2050 and calls to set transition in motion
Short Description: The Commission welcomes the agreement reached today at the International Maritime Organization (IMO) to revise its 2018 strategy on reducing greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions from ships.

Title: Global Gateway: EU funded study opens the way for major investment into sustainable transport connections between the EU and Central Asia
Short Description: The Commission published the results of the Study on Sustainable Transport Connections between Europe and Central Asia as one of the actions taken to implement the Global Gateway strategy.

Title: We collect #BikesForUkraine
Short Description: We collect #BikesForUkraine

Title: EU invests €6.2 billion in sustainable, safe and efficient transport infrastructure
Short Description: The Commission has selected 107 transport infrastructure projects to receive over €6 billion in EU grants from the CEF.

Title: Increasing public transport use in the EU: Commission adopts Interpretative Guidelines for public service obligations in land transport
Short Description: The Commission adopted revised Interpretative Guidelines on public passenger transport services by rail and road, presenting the Commission’s interpretation of key provisions within EU legislation.  The document improves legal certainty for all actors applying the EU legal framework.

Title: G7 Transport Ministerial Declaration
Short Description: The G7 Transport Ministers' Meeting is a meeting in which the G7 Transport Ministers and the EU Commissioner for Transport get together to take up important themes that determine the future of transportation (and therefore, the society as a whole) and to discuss key directions.

Title: EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: new tool shows rail traffic situation
Short Description: The ‘EU-Ukraine Visibility Map’ launched by transportation management platform Transporeon in collaboration with infrastructure managers’ association RailNetEurope.

Title: Sustainable transport: rules to boost intelligent transport systems for safer and more efficient transport agreed
Short Description: The Commission welcomes the political agreement reached between the European Parliament and the Council on a proposal made by the Commission in 2021 on the revision of the Intelligent Transport Systems (ITS) Directive.

Title: Rail transport: passengers to enjoy better protection and smoother travel experience
Short Description: A new set of EU rules to strengthen rail passenger protection applies from today. As of now, passengers are better protected if their travel is disrupted, and railway companies must ensure a trouble-free travel experience for passengers with reduced mobility.

Title: European Commission further integrates Ukraine into EU Single Market through the Connecting Europe Facility for infrastructure funding
Short Description: Commissioner for Transport Adina Vălean and Deputy Prime Minister for Restoration of Ukraine and Minister for Communities, Territories and Infrastructure Development Oleksandr Kubrakov, signed an agreement in Lviv, associating Ukraine to the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF) programme.

Title: Maritime safety: new proposals to support clean and modern shipping
Short Description: The Commission presented five legislative proposals to modernise EU rules on maritime safety and prevent water pollution from ships.

Title: June infringement package: key decisions
Short Description: June infringement package: key decisions

Title: Joint Communiqué by the U.S. Department of Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg and the European Commissioner for Transport, Adina Vălean on transatlantic cooperation
Short Description: Secretary of Transportation of the United States of America, Pete Buttigieg and European Commissioner for Transport, Adina Vălean, met on May 22, 2023, to discuss EU-U.S. support to Ukraine, ongoing cooperation in aviation and maritime transport, as well as issues of common interest in transport.

Title: Road Transport: Commission proposes to adapt rules on driving and rest times for drivers of occasional bus and coach services
Short Description: The Commission today proposed to adapt EU rules on breaks and rest periods for drivers to better reflect the nature of occasional bus and coach services. Drivers in this sector have a different work rhythm compared to those in freight or regular passenger transport.

Title: Decarbonising aviation: European Commission to support development of sustainable aviation fuels around the world
Short Description: The Commission announced support for the development of sustainable aviation fuels (SAF) under the International Civil Aviation Organization’s (ICAO) Capacity-building and Training for Sustainable Aviation Fuels programme (ACT-SAF)?

Title: Connecting Europe: Commission signs high-level agreements with Western Balkans to improve transport links
Short Description: The Commission signed high-level agreements with Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Kosovo, Montenegro, North Macedonia and Serbia.

Title: European Commission further integrates Moldova into EU Single Market through the Connecting Europe Facility for infrastructure funding
Short Description: Commissioner for Transport Adina Vălean and Moldova’s Prime Minister, Dorin Recean, signed an agreement in Chisinau, associating Moldova to the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF) programme.

Title: Road transport emissions: Road charging advantages for efficient trailers
Short Description: The Commission proposes to take into account the effect of trailers on the CO2 emissions of heavy-goods vehicles in road charging schemes that differentiate tolls based on vehicles’ CO2 emissions.

Title: EU transport infrastructure: EUR 790 million available for military mobility
Short Description: The Commission launches a call for proposals under the CEF for projects that address both civilian and defence needs along the trans-European transport network (TEN-T)

Title: Urban Mobility Days
Short Description: Save the Date for Urban Mobility Days 2023 taking place from 4-6 October in Seville, Spain.

Title: European Green Deal: new law agreed to cut aviation emissions by promoting sustainable aviation fuels
Short Description: The Commission welcomes the political agreement on the ReFuelEU Aviation proposal between the European Parliament and the Council.

Title: EU and India deepen ties at aviation summit
Short Description: The EU-India Aviation Summit in New Delhi confirmed the shared objective of further deepening EU-India political, technical, and industrial cooperation on aviation.

Title: EU – India Aviation Summit: Opening speech by Commissioner Adina Vălean
Short Description: Opening speech by Commissioner Adina Vălean at the EU – India Aviation Summit.

Title: April Infringements package: key decisions
Short Description: April Infringements package: key decisions

Title: Vacancy for a post of Executive Director (Temporary Agent– AD14) at the Europe's Rail Joint Undertaking (EU-RAIL)
Short Description: The deadline for applications is 15 May 2023 at 12.00 noon (Central European Time/ Brussels time)

Title: Continuously open call for applications for the selection of member organisations of the Stakeholders Advisory Group on Maritime Security
Short Description: The Commission is calling for applications with a view to renewing the membership of the informal expert group entitled ‘Stakeholders Advisory Group on Maritime Security’ by selecting members other than Member States' authorities.

Title: First RLCF workshop: recent developments and projects to boost production and supply of renewable and low-carbon fuels
Short Description: RLCF Value Chain Industrial Alliance have held their first workshop, discussing the latest developments within the industry and presenting projects in areas such as feedstock sourcing, fuel production, and the uptake of aviation and maritime fuels.

Title: Maritime transport: Commission continues to recognise Filipino seafarer’s certificates
Short Description: The Commission has decided to continue recognising certificates for seafarers issued by the Philippines, one of the world’s largest maritime labour supply countries.

Title: European Commission publishes key indicators of road safety in Europe
Short Description: The Commission has published the results of the Baseline project on 8 key performance indicators that influence road safety in Europe.

Title: European Green Deal: ambitious new law agreed to deploy sufficient alternative fuels infrastructure
Short Description: The Commission welcomes the political agreement reached between the European Parliament and the Council to boost the number of publicly accessible electric recharging and hydrogen refuelling stations in particular across the European Union's main transport corridors and hubs.

Title: European urban mobility awards: Braga and Metropolia GZM rewarded for their green mobility actions
Short Description: The Commission presented the European urban mobility awards for 2022.

Title: European Green Deal: Agreement reached on cutting maritime transport emissions by promoting sustainable fuels for shipping
Short Description: The Commission welcomes the political agreement reached between the Parliament and the Council that increases the maritime transport sector's contribution to reaching the EU-wide target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions by at least 55% by 2030, and to achieving climate neutrality in 2050.

Title: Reducing transport emissions: Commission adopts guidelines to improve vehicle inspections
Short Description: The European Commission today published a recommendation to improve the periodical technical inspection of vehicles.

Title: Alternative fuels infrastructure: €189 million in EU funding for projects supporting greener mobility
Short Description: The Commission announced 26 projects from 12 Member States selected for funding to install alternative fuels infrastructure along the trans-European transport network (TEN-T).

Title: No title
Short Description: The modernisation of 178 km of the Palermo-Catania line will reduce current travel times by a third, linking the two cities with a direct two-hour rail service, which will have a significant impact on economic, social, and sustainable development in Sicily.

Title: Commission guides Member States on sustainable urban mobility planning
Short Description: On 8 March, the Commission adopted a Recommendation designed to help Member States support their towns and cities in cutting transport emissions and improving urban mobility.

Title: Sustainable Transport Forum – new membership appointments
Short Description: Appointment of the Members of the group of experts on alternative transport fuels ('the Sustainable Transport Forum')

Title: European Commission proposes updated requirements for driving licences and better cross-border enforcement of road traffic rules
Short Description: Commission proposes updated requirements for driving licences and better cross-border enforcement of road traffic rules

Title: No title
Short Description: The finalists for the EUROPEANMOBILITYWEEK award 2022 and the first-ever MOBILITYACTION award have been announced.

Title: Road safety in the EU: fatalities below pre-pandemic levels but progress remains too slow
Short Description: Road safety in the EU 2022: Around 20,600 people were killed in road crashes last year

Title: February infringements package: key decisions
Short Description: February infringements package: key decisions

Title: Public workshop on the Multimodal Digital Mobility Services initiative
Short Description: The Commission will organise a stakeholder workshop on the ongoing impact assessment on the initiative on Multimodal Digital Mobility Services (MDMS), including the retained provisions from the Code of Conduct of Computerised Reservation Systems.

Title: Union for the Mediterranean: Transport Ministers reaffirm Euro-Mediterranean cooperation
Short Description: The Transport Ministers of the Union for the Mediterranean (UfM) reaffirmed the shared objectives of regional cooperation by adopting the UfM Ministerial Declaration and a new Regional Transport Action Plan (RTAP) when they met on 9 February.

Title: Maritime transport: supporting industry by reducing the administrative burden
Short Description: The Commission is taking another important step today towards the implementation of the European Maritime Single Window environment (EMSWe) with the publication of a Delegated Regulation and an Implementing Regulation.

Title: Commission tables extension to EU-Ukraine road transport agreement
Short Description: The EU has proposed an extension to the temporary road transport agreement signed with Ukraine, which has allowed Ukrainian hauliers to increase their operations on EU roads by around 40%.

Title: Multimodal Passenger Mobility Forum – final report
Short Description: The Multimodal Passenger Mobility Forum (MPMF) was set up to assist the Commission in the preparation of policy initiatives in the field of sustainable multimodal mobility for passengers.

Title: Public workshop on creating a common European mobility data space (EMDS)
Short Description: Stakeholder workshop for the upcoming Communication on creating a common European mobility data space (EMDS).

Title: Stakeholder conference on mitigating the social impact of the transition to automation and digitalisation in transport
Short Description: The Commission plans to issue a Recommendation in 2023 on means to mitigate the impact of the transition to automation and digitalisation on the transport workforce.

Title: Connecting Europe by train: 10 EU pilot services to boost cross-border rail
Short Description: The European Commission will support 10 pilot projects to establish new rail services or improve existing ones.

Title: CINEA launches a new public dashboard covering all of its projects and programmes
Short Description: The European Climate, Infrastructure and Environment Executive Agency (CINEA) has launched its online public dashboard bringing together all the programmes that have been entrusted to it by the European Commission.

Title: January Infringements package: key decisions
Short Description: January Infringements package: key decisions

Title: New EU rules on dedicated airspace for drones enter into force
Short Description: As of today, EU rules establishing a dedicated airspace for drones known as the U-space become applicable, allowing unmanned air service operators to provide a wider range of safe and efficient services.

Title: Factsheet: EU solidarity with Ukraine - latest figures
Short Description: EU solidarity with Ukraine - latest figures on EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes and more

Title: EU transport infrastructure: speeding-up investment in military mobility
Short Description: The Commission is speeding up the financing of 35 military mobility projects to support the transport of troops and equipment along the trans-European transport network (TEN-T).

Title: "Europe for Aviation” teams up for Airspace World
Short Description: The “Europe for Aviation” partners will come together at Airspace World (formerly World ATM Congress), from 8 to 10 March 2023 in Geneva, Switzerland.

Title: New Mobility Patterns Study: insights into passenger mobility and urban logistics
Short Description: Results of a broad study on new mobility patterns, unveiling the mobility choices of citizens across the EU, and how the urban logistics sector is developing in 16 cities.

Title: Future Mobility: €40 million EIB loan for Cabify to finance a zero-emission fleet of electric vehicles in Spain
Short Description: The EIB is providing the Spanish multi-mobility platform Cabify with a €40 million loan to decarbonise its fleet of vehicles in Spain, by increasing the availability of new electric vehicles and charging infrastructure across the country.

Title: New shipping fuel standards to reduce sulphur oxides in the Mediterranean by 80%
Short Description: The Commission welcomes the agreement reached by the IMO to step up protection of the Mediterranean, with a considerable tightening of the rules on exhaust gases from ships.
